intro: Randia ciliolata, commonly known as the silky randia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a soft, hairy texture. Randia ciliolata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
